Who doesn’t want a badass action packed western I think westerns have a great potential to be fun action movies Something that director Antoine Fuqua excels at doing. He is able to bring back some of the old school elements that made westerns great Before a gun battle begins there are always stare downs between multiple people The squinting eyes the fingers reaching for the gun the sweat dripping down from the forehead … these are what add more tension to what is coming. Denzel Washington is as charismatic and mysterious as a western hero could be. From the moment he appears on screen he just oozes charis m a. Its roles like this that make us constantly fall in love with him Everyone else in this movie has a unique charisma that makes them interesting. Chris Pratt plays the outlaw gambler who is snarky yet charming He is still similar to Star Lord in Guardians of the Galaxy but he also excels at the type that he plays Ethan Hawke was the most layered character in here He has a way of being playful vulnerable but also being a badass when the showdown goes down Lesser known actors like Manuel Garcia Rulfo and Martin Sensmeier also get to shine They have distinguishable personalities that make them vital additions to the c rew instead of just being present to fill in the slots. These people are basically superheroes when it comes to the action They are all crack shots that can take down an army of henchmen in seconds But within the action there are little character moments that are entertaining It was like watch ing a western version of The Avengers. The problem is these action scenes are very few and far in between There are only two major scenes that happen One towards the beginning and the final showdown in the end In between there was too much uncompelling drama with t he towns people whose villages were invaded. This could have been another John Wick if there was just one more action scene in between But in a time where most action movies have too much CGI spectacle in them it was good to see a movie with grounded action and fun characters to rely on the entertainment factor.
